textboxes.description: While wandering through a misty meadow, you spot a peculiar sight—a large wooly sheep with a coat so fluffy it almost looks magical. The sheep stares at you with bright, intelligent eyes, but backs away slightly as you approach.

choices.text: Offer it a handful of grass

textboxes.description: You approach slowly, but the sheep bleats nervously and backs away further, clearly still uneasy.

choices.text: Try to lure it closer with food

textboxes.description: The sheep eyes the grass you offer, and, after a moment of hesitation, steps forward to nibble. You sense it’s warming up to you.
You whisper a simple spell, and the sheep visibly relaxes, its breathing slowing as it settles down in the grass, watching you with calm, trusting eyes.
You give the sheep plenty of space, and after a few minutes, it begins to approach you on its own, curious but cautious.

choices.text: Reach out to let it sniff your hand

textboxes.description: You reach out, and the sheep allows you to touch its incredibly soft, wooly coat. A warmth spreads through your hand as you feel a faint magical energy in its wool.
The sheep eats peacefully, gaining a bit more trust. After finishing, it nudges you gently, as if it wants to follow you.

choices.text: Lead it back toward your campsite
Let it stay in the meadow

textboxes.description: The sheep settles beside you, its warmth comforting in the cool meadow air. You feel a quiet bond forming with the gentle creature.

choices.text: Try to lead it home with you

textboxes.description: You carefully gather a handful of wool from the sheep, feeling the magical energy infused in it. The wool shimmers faintly in the moonlight, a rare and valuable material for crafting.

choices.text: Thank the sheep and let it be
Try to tame it as a companion

textboxes.description: The sheep seems content to follow you, bleating softly as it trots beside you. Congratulations—you’ve gained a wooly friend!
As you walk away, the sheep watches you go, its eyes bright and kind. Perhaps you'll cross paths again someday.
